contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Obata'''|小俣町|Obata-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Watarai District, Mie|Watarai District]], [[Mie Prefecture|Mie]], [[Japan]]. On November 1, 2005 Obata, along with the town of [[Futami, Mie|Futami]], and the village of [[Misono, Mie|Misono]], all from [[Watarai District, Mie|Watarai District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Ise, Mie|Ise]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 18,437 and a [[population density|density]] of 1,594.90 persons per km². The total area was 11.56 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.ise.mie.jp/ Official website of Ise] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Mie Prefecture]] {{Mie-geo-stub}}
